intro: Lithocardium gerascanthus var. domingense, commonly known as the Dominican lithocardium, is a rare and endemic species native to the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth texture and a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
